title: Yanchen Jiang (Jeff Jiang)
text:
Hello! My name is Yanchen Jiang (I also use the name Jeff Jiang).
I’m a third year Computer Science PhD candidate at Harvard University, advised by Professor David C. Parkes and Professor Yiling Chen. My research interests lie in leveraging machine learning to study EconCS, decision-making, and multi-agent AI.
I obtained my Bachelor’s degree from Harvard College in 2022, with a major (joint concentration) in Computer Science and Mathematics and a minor (secondary) in Statistics.
I have been the Head TA of Harvard’s CS136: Economics and Computation in Fall 2023, and a TA for the same course (CS136) in Fall 2021.
You can find more information about current projects I’m working on and prior academic publications on the Publications & Projects page and my contact information. You can find my CV here.

title: Contact Information
text:
Yanchen (Jeff) Jiang

The best way to contact me is at the email address above.

title: Publications & Projects
text:
Academic Publications
* indicates equal contribution, (\(\alpha\)-\(\beta\)) indicates alphabetical author order.

Conference Publications:
1. GemNet: Menu-Based, Strategy-Proof Multi-Bidder Auctions Through Deep Learning  Tonghan Wang*, Yanchen Jiang* , David C. Parkes. The Twenty-Fifth ACM Conference on Economics and Computation (EC’24), Preprint.  Won Exemplary Paper Award for the AI track (presented at the Best EC 24 papers plenary session).
2. Data Market Design through Deep Learning  Sai Srivatsa Ravindranath*, Yanchen Jiang* , David C. Parkes. Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 36 (NeurIPS 2023). Publication, Preprint.


Workshop and Exhibition Papers:
1. Charting the Shapes of Stories with Game Theory  (\(\alpha\)-\(\beta\)) Constantinos Daskalakis, Ian Gemp, Yanchen Jiang, Renato Paes Leme, Christos Papadimitriou, Georgios Piliouras. Preprint, NeurIPS 2024 Creative AI.
2. Evidence from the Synthetic Laboratory: Language Models as Auction Participants Anand Shah*, Kehang Zhu*, Yanchen Jiang, Kerem Dayi, Jeffery Wang, John J. Horton, David C. Parkes.  EC’24 contributed poster session; NeurIPS 2024 Workshop on Behavioral Machine Learning. Preprint.


Preprints in submission:
1. On Diffusion Models for Multi-Agent Partial Observability: Shared Attractors, Error Bounds, and Composite Flow  Tonghan Wang*, Heng Dong*, Yanchen Jiang, David C. Parkes, Milind Tambe. Preprint.
